Articles.Content:
Hello everyone! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Today I want to show you my newest creation:

**VTOL fighter "Stribog"**

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/17X41)

"Stribog" named after Stribog - slavic god of winds - because of its high maneuverability (so I recommend you to use RCS in your first flights). This fighter is a multirole VTOL. It can be used in attack and support missions. You can find detailed description of "Stribog" in an imgur album above.

Craft's characteristics:

Parts - 380

Mass, t - 14,3

Height, m - 2,9

Weight, m - 5,9

Lenght, m - 9,2

Hotkeys:

1 - toggle VTOL engine

2 - toggle main engine

Abort - activate ejection seat

Click [>>here<<](http://www./download/dnkfda4help0886/Stribog.craft) to download a .craft-file!

Thank you for your attention!

Fly safe!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-04T19:30:30Z" title="04/04/2015 07:30  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 4, 2015</time> by Nik\_601**
Very nice, I really like what you've done with the solar panels.

> 
> Very nice, I really like what you've done with the solar panels.

I'll 2nd that. I didn't even notice them at first. you should add it to the aesthetics thread ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Thanks for the cool new idea ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) Rep for you good Sir ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Very nice, I really like what you've done with the solar panels.

> 
> I'll 2nd that. I didn't even notice them at first. you should add it to the aesthetics thread ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Thanks for the cool new idea ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) Rep for you good Sir ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Thanks for the comments!

P.S. Actually, that technic isn't new - a lot of engineers here use it when building hollow cabins:)
I like its ejective seat and asimmetric design! Looks interesting)
